Content.Name: Excess Baggage
Content.Description: The adventures, frustrations and joys of travel are explored by wanderlust presenter, Sandi Toksvig

Content.Description: Tom Sutcliffe and guests review the week's cultural events

Content.Description: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes

Content.Name: Poetry Please
Content.Description: Roger McGough features listeners' requests for poetry about birds, including Thomas Hardy's The Darkling Thrush and George Meredith's The Lark Ascending

Content.Name: The Great Debates
Content.Description: Allan Little re-visits great debates of the past

Content.Name: From Our Own Correspondent
Content.Description: Insight, colour, wit and analysis as the BBC's foreign correspondents take a closer look at the stories in their regions

Content.Name: The Now Show
Content.Description: Comedy sketches and satirical comments from Steve Punt, Hugh Dennis and the team

Content.Name: Any Questions?
Content.Description: Jonathan Dimbleby chairs a topical discussion from Rowhedge in Essex

Content.Description: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4

Content.Description: Michael Angelis recalls the career of the Vernons Girls, an all-girl group from Liverpool who rose to success in the male-dominated popular music scene of the 1950s and early 60s

Content.Name: Talking Politics
Content.Description: Dennis Sewell and guests provide fresh insight into the ideas and issues, as well as current political events

Content.Name: Money Box
Content.Description: Paul Lewis with the latest news from the world of personal finance plus impartial advice for those trying to make the most of their money

Content.Description: Jonathan Dimbleby takes listeners' calls in response to today's edition of Any Questions? To air your views call 08700 100 444 [national rates]

Content.Name: The Saturday Play
Content.Description: Agatha Christie's Elephants Can Remember: A question posed by a formidable busybody sends Hercule Poirot and Ariadne Oliver on a quest to unravel the mystery of a tragedy from the past

Content.Name: Saturday PM
Content.Description: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news
